reviews.text: This is a nice little hotel with plenty of parking, a comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The location was perfect for what we needed and it was an easy drive down to Hamilton. The rooms weren’t very soundproof (common with older buildings like this) so you could hear everything in the other rooms but they put a door between the rooms and the bar so it wasn’t a big issue.

reviews.text: My daughter was rowing for Ireland at the recent Homes International Rowing Competition which was held at Strathclyde Park. We choose the Moorings Hotel as it was near the Strathclyde Park. Three other families stayed as well and were all delighted with the good value of the family rooms. The food was excellent. The dinner menu suited all palates and the children were delighted. The Hotel is like a large Guest House with a very good restaurant. There are no other facilities in it but that suited us as we were out and about all three days. The M&D Theme Park is also in Strathclyde Park. We all went there. Small but still fun for the children. Overall the Moorings was a very good choice, simple clean and friendly. It is located very near the town of Motherwell and about 10 minute walk to Strathclyde Park. Colette Cork Ireland
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night (Saturday) and were impressed. The room although in the basement was well decorated and had tea and coffee making facilities. Also satellite television. The bathroom was small but adequate and had a shower over a bath. Not my favourite as I prefer a shower room but the power shower was fine. We booked bed and breakfast and the breakfast on the Sunday was very good, cereals and fruit juice as well as fresh fruit followed by a cooked breakfast which offered a choice of porridge, smoked fish, full scottish breakfast with a choice of cooked eggs. Service was first class and every request was met with a smile and nothing seemed to be a problem. Could we please take this hotel round Europe with us. We would certainly have no problem recommending or booking into this hotel in the future. Only 5 minutes off the M74.
reviews.title: small private wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service overall was excellent. We stayed as part of a wedding party. We returned to hotel after wedding reception. Unfortunately, there was nowhere downstairs for us to sit. However, staff did find us a couple of tables & chairs & suppleid us with some complimentary buffet food! Rooms are modern & spotless. Beds are very comfortable. Food is amazing! My only gripe, was the man who showed us to our room watched me struggle up 3 flights of stairs with 2 suitcases & a bag & did not offer to help!

reviews.text: Hotel is very centrally located. Public areas were quite modern and comfortable. Room was a bit 'twee', but had all amenities. Good breakfast, plenty parking. Positive - decent rate of £65 for two inc breakfast., although we could have got a Holiday Inn Express or Hilton in Strathclyde Country Park for same money. Negative - bathroom tiny with towel rail over toilet bowl - an accident waiting to happen!
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Before I stayed in The Moorings, I was already reassured of a good experience. A work colleague always stays there and I checked out this website which spoke volumes. Even before arriving, the hotel got my seal of approval. I was due to arrrive late - about 10:30 pm and asked if it would be possible to order a late snack for myself and my colleague. One or two e-mails later I was assured that the chef would prepare something for us. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff, check in was very efficient and we were told without asking that our food was ready and a table set aside. Within minutes we had drinks and food. Our 'snack' was a plate of 16 sandwiches, a bowl of salad, some potato crisps and two generous bowls of fries, again all was served with great courtesy. The rooms were excellent, very clean, modern and with all the usual refinements. A good night's sleep was followed by a great breakfast, a wide choice and again the staff were very attentive. I will be returning to Motherwell soon and know exactly where I will be staying. I thoroughly recommend this hotel. In summary, the cornerstone of this establishment is good service delivered with a smile.
reviews.title: If I'm in Motherwell and need a hotel, it will always be The Moorings....
